metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40085 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Neutron before 16.4.1, 17.x before 17.2.1, and 18.x before 18.1.1. Authenticated attackers can reconfigure dnsmasq via a crafted extra_dhcp_opts value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-l3-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-metering-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-ovn-metadata-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-server - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
python3-neutron - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This issue was fixed in (2:16.4.1-0ubuntu2) in focal-updates and (2:18.1.1-0ubuntu2) in hirsute-updates, and was later released to -security.

criterions.comment: neutron package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1').
